node.text: I love that you’re having real conversations and being open and honest with your boys. 🙌🏽
@thematernalhobbyist thank you ❤️ am constantly trying to create conversation on this.

• PEACE  EDUCATION ☮️ •

The boys asked, “Mummy, what’s going on?” as they saw buildings being burnt, people protesting, chaos ensued. I began to talk about what had happened - a man named #georgefloyd who had died after a police officer pressed his knee into his neck for more than eight minutes, despite his cries saying #icantbreathe. I didn’t mention race at first; they were shocked enough that one human being could do this to another.

I then slowly introduced the fact that Floyd was an African American, a black man, and the police officer is a white man. They previously had no notion of what black and white are - we are all just humans with different skin colour. I then invited them to colour their “gingerbread men” with different skin colours, an activity I learnt from @3mm.montessori, and introduced them as peaceful people; that we are all beautiful no matter our skin colour. Though they still found it a little odd because it really didn’t matter to them right from the start. How lovely, this sweet innocence.

I went on to introduce Martin Luther King Jr, all thanks to @showmehistorybooks for gifting this to us. His life story, in comics form, proved to drive the point of how the blacks had come a long way in the black rights movement - how they were discriminated against, bullied, beaten just because of their skin colour. The boys were appalled and looked a bit more disturbed. We then discussed ways of how to stop this violence - 👦🏻J7 said we should all just be friends; 👦🏻J8 said we could try convincing the other people not to hurt others. It’s never easy, isn’t it?

I admit, I never introduce the idea of race to them explicitly because I had thought it would make them notice the difference when there is no need for it. As they were growing up, they had noticed but never asked why their friends looked different - merely why some of their friends fast, why some of their friends celebrate different festivals. Today on the last day of #circuitbreakersg, they learnt that not all men look the same, and not all men treat all men the same. But we can all make a difference - just by knowing for a start.
•
#blacklivesmatter #activitiesforequality #playtoshine
@yazookiddo thank you Ari ❤️
What a brilliant way to spark up such an important topic, Jasmine! ❤️
@heuristicmommas ❤️
Such an important thing to talk to our little ones about ❤️
@beansplaybox a small step is better than none ❤️ jiayou 💪🏻

thanks for sharing this book ! I’m also looking out for more resources to start to educate the little ones on important issues in our society. i think as parents, we play an important role to raise the next generation to be empathetic, gracious and action-takers. Thanks for sparking the conversations !!!
@momofthegalaxy as I was reading the book with my older boys, my heart just sank lower and lower, knowing that 52 years on, the world is still in the same state, if not worse.
This is so timely Jas. ❤️The incident also made me revisit a book and a compilation of Martin Luther King Jr.'s famous speeches. So heartbreaking. 💔
@honeybeesactivities thank you!
An excellent idea x
@playfreelykids ❤️
Great way to teach and start a conversation!
@learningthroughplaytime ❤️
Such an important thing to talk about
@bilinguallifestyle thank you ❤️
Love this so much! Thanks for sharing 🙌
@mangosandmayhem I’m totally with you on this. It’s not easy. But we will all get there ❤️
We had a big discussion with our two oldest about this last night. It’s a hard talk to@have but nothing will change unless we recognize the problem and make efforts to do what we cam
@everyday_is_playday ❤️❤️❤️ we can all start small somewhere together.
I think it is so important to have these discussions in age appropriate ways. And when you can use a book, even better. 💖
@toddleratplay thank you!
I’m loving this book and activity 😊
@little_mini_lighthouse_ thank you so much ❤️
So important, beautiful craft with it 💙
@play.with.sara thank you ❤️
I love this 💕
@adventures_w_lalalucy yes to them! It’s difficult but we must try. Baby steps ❤️
Its really hard to have discussions like this knowledge is power ❤️
@growing_unplugged never too late to begin ❤️
This is such an important discussion❤️
@3mm.montessori it’s from @showmehistorybooks ❤️
So important - and what a beautiful, important book ❤️
@twolightsacademy thank you! This is such an important lesson 😍😍😍
@jaslearningwithkids - I agree! You’re welcome. ❤️
I absolutely love that you are teaching this!! ❤️🙌🏽❤️
@chinesekidlit it won’t be easy, but as we work our muscle memory, we will get stronger and more comfortable with talking about such matters 💪🏻❤️
Thank you so much for sharing your experience about teaching this important and challenging topic! Praying that more families to talk about it openly! ❤️❤️❤️
@thematernalhobbyist thank you ❤️ am constantly trying to create conversation on this.
I love that you’re having real conversations and being open and honest with your boys. 🙌🏽
